title._content: [Portrait of Bobby Hackett, Paramount Theater, New York, N.Y., ca. Aug. 1946] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Bobby Hackett, Paramount Theater, New York, N.Y., ca. Aug. 1946] 1 negative : b&w ; 3 1/4 x 4 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Caught this shot of Bobby at the Paramount, where he alternately worked with and vacationed from the Glen Gray band. Glen is rumored to be retiring. If so, there's an outside chance that Bobby will take over the Casa Lomans . . . If not, he'll organize a new unit of his own with Gray support. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 393 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: The Record Changer, v. 5, no. 6 (Aug. 46, 1946), p. 13. Subjects: Hackett, Bobby Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Trumpet players--1940-1950. Paramount Theater Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.03721 Call Number: LC-GLB23- 0372
